Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency assessed an $8 million civil money penalty against Zions First National Bank, Salt Lake City, Utah, for violations of the Bank Secrecy Act and the USA Patriot Act.
Agency: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

Company: ZB N.A. (fka Zions First National Bank)
Description: ZB, N.A, formerly known as Zions First National Bank, N.A., settled allegations that it and an affiliated payment processor facilitated consumer fraud by providing payment processing services to telemarketing and Internet merchants that were debiting money illegally from consumers' bank accounts.

The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority fined Zions Direct, Inc. $225,000 for failing to disclose the potential conflict of interest created by the participation of its affiliate, Liquid Asset Management, in online CD auctions conducted by Zions involving certificates of deposit issued by Zions-affiliated banks.
Notes: FINRA is a securities industry self-regulatory body authorized by the federal government.
